item.title: Sunken drain cover/ironwork, 23rd January
item.description:
Previously report reference number is 8657710 - states FIXED. Not correct, the ironwork is still well below road surface and vehicles still veering to avoid. A small amount of tarmace stuffed around the edge appears to be the reason for stating its fixed but it is not. Not safe for vehicles
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 143, Maidstone Road, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole 2000mm long, 450mm wide, 250mm deep, 23rd January
item.description:
Huge pothole or crevasse in the road. Pothole 2000mm long, 450mm wide, 250mm deep Really dangerous for motorbikes in the underpass, as as certain times of the day you can't see it, as the shadow of the bridge masks the road defect. It's huge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Underpass, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Base of tree is rotten, 23rd January
item.description:
This tree outside 204 Herne Hill Road, SE24 0AE appears to be unhealthy with a significant amount of decay and fungus near its base. I don’t know if it’s been reported and inspected yet but it needs to be to make sure it is safe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Herne Hill Road, Herne Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Serious pothole towards the herb. Must be 400mm on all sides and 300mm deep, 23rd January
item.description:
Westbound Woolwich Road, after the Petrol station (possibly as far as the Pickwick Pub), there is a huge hole 400mm square, and 300mm deep. My main concern other than damaging vehicles, is cars are swerving to miss it, and I have seen near misses with two-wheelers filtering through traffic. A collision is pending. The whole of the woolwich road between Anchor and Hope and the A2/A102 MUST be over due a survey. The holes are terrible, as is the road heave. Marking have also worn away. I'd love the see the risk-assessment or the report that says that this road is ok.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken manhole cover associated with the telephone cabinet, 23rd January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Muirkirk Road, Catford South, Greater London

item.title: Serious pothole in the road, 23rd January
item.description:
Woowich Road, Westbound, just after the Mcdonalds Roundabout. The roadworks direct the traffic into the bus lane. Just as you enter the bus lane, there is a large, unavoidable pothole, serious enough to damage vehicles. Needs urgent attention.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Serious potholes in the road, 23rd January
item.description:
Serious potholes in the road, IN ADDITION to a poorly filled trench across the road that really needs a steel road plate. I'd suggest someone from the council surveys the temporary works. It's shocking. Pothole still remains, as a separate issue aside from the temporary works.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Penhall Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Laughing gas canisters and rubbish dumped on street, 23rd January
item.description:
A large quantity of laughing gas canisters, boxes and other assorted rubbish has been dumped on the street corner by our flat. This is on the corner of Sudrey Street and Lant St. This is a recurring issue, please attempt to identify the culprits using the contents of the rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 175, Southwark Bridge Road, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping & dumping, 23rd January
item.description:
Hello. Yet more people dumping stuff everywhere and filling up every single bin. The enforcement of this is appalling. People and children live here

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Passage, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Three new non visibility Guardrails installed, 23rd January
item.description:
Three non-visibility pedestrian guardrails have been installed outside a gated entrance to Upland Primary School on a blind bend. These guardrails should be the visibility type with a sight gap. As per those installed along the other entrances at Harlington Rd school entrances. The 'Sight-Gap' type provides increased vision for motorists especially on a bend.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harlington Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: "Amnesia whip" boxes and gas cans, 23rd January
item.description:
Someone has dumped amnesia whip boxes and gas cannisters at the intersection between Lant Street and Sudrey Street. This has been present for a week now

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 175, Southwark Bridge Road, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still not removed shopping trollies, 23rd January
